Class Out

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.View.TUI.Out
public class Out extends Object
The Out class manages the output and state representation of a game, enabling interactions and updates to game visuals and player data. This class serves as a bridge for rendering the game state, facilitating communication between backend game components and user-facing interfaces.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Out(InputReader inputReader, PlayerClient playerClient)
    Constructs an instance of the Out class, initializing necessary components and caches.

  • Constructor Details

    • Out

      public Out(InputReader inputReader, PlayerClient playerClient)
      Constructs an instance of the Out class, initializing necessary components and caches.
      Parameters:
      inputReader - an InputReader instance used to receive input for the game.
      playerClient - a PlayerClient instance used to manage player interactions.

  • Method Details

    • setOthersPB

      public void setOthersPB(String playerId, int x, int y, String[] cell)
      Updates the board of other players with specific data at a given position.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The unique identifier of the player whose board is being updated.
      x - The x-coordinate on the player's board where the update is applied.
      y - The y-coordinate on the player's board where the update is applied.
      cell - The data to be inserted at the specified position on the board.

    • setOthersPB

      public void setOthersPB(String playerId, int x, int y, int k, String s)
      Updates or initializes the game board for another player identified by playerId at a specific position (x, y) with the given value in a specific layer (k).
      Parameters:
      playerId - the unique identifier of the player whose game board is being updated
      x - the x-coordinate of the cell on the board
      y - the y-coordinate of the cell on the board
      k - the layer index within the cell of the board
      s - the value to be set in the specified cell and layer

    • getLock

      public Object getLock()
      Provides access to the lock object associated with the current instance. This method typically returns an object that can be used for synchronization purposes.
      Returns:
      the lock object used for synchronization

    • getPlayerToPosition

      public HashMap<String,Integer> getPlayerToPosition()
      Retrieves the mapping of player IDs to their corresponding positions.
      Returns:
      a HashMap where the keys are player IDs (as Strings) and the values are their positions (as Integers)

    • setCardId

      public void setCardId(int cardId)
      Updates the card ID and sets the corresponding title card based on the card ID.
      Parameters:
      cardId - the unique identifier for the card. Based on its value, the method assigns a specific title from the ASCII_ART collection to the titleCard field. Acceptable ranges and their corresponding title categories are: - 1, 2: TitleSlavers - 3, 4: TitleSmugglers - 5, 6: TitlePirates - 7-10: TitleAbandonedShip - 11-14: TitleAbandonedStation - 15-20: TitleMeteorSwarm - 21-28: TitlePlanets - 29-35: TitleOpenSpace - 36, 37: TitleCombatZone - 38, 39: TitleStardust - 40: TitleEpidemic

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(ArrayList<String> players)
      Sets the list of player IDs and updates the `otherPlayersBoard` map by removing entries for players that are no longer in the provided list.
      Parameters:
      players - an ArrayList of player IDs to set as the current players

    • setReady

      public void setReady(ArrayList<Boolean> ready)
      Sets the readiness status for the players.
      Parameters:
      ready - an ArrayList of Boolean values indicating the readiness status of each player. Each Boolean represents whether a specific player is ready (true) or not (false).

    • setCachedBoard

      public void setCachedBoard(int x, int y, String[] cell)
      Updates the cached board at the specified coordinates with the given cell data.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate on the cached board.
      y - the y-coordinate on the cached board.
      cell - the array of strings representing the cell data to be set at the specified coordinates.

    • setCachedBoard

      public void setCachedBoard(int x, int y, int k, String cell)
      Updates the cached board by setting the specified value at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the board.
      y - the y-coordinate of the board.
      k - the specific layer or level in the board structure.
      cell - the value to set in the specified position on the board.

    • setCacheHand

      public void setCacheHand(String[] cacheHand)
      Sets the cache for the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      cacheHand - An array of strings representing the cached hand of the player.

    • setUncoveredTilesId

      public void setUncoveredTilesId(int id)
      Updates the list of uncovered tile IDs by adding or removing the specified ID. If the ID already exists in the list, it will be removed. Otherwise, it will be added.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the tile to be added or removed from the

    • setUncoverdTileSetCache

      public void setUncoverdTileSetCache(int i, String[] cache)
      Updates the uncovered tile set cache for a given index. If the cache parameter is not null, it stores the cache array in the uncoverdTileSetCache map using the index. If the cache parameter is null, it removes the entry for the specified index from the uncoverdTileSetCache map.
      Parameters:
      i - the index at which the tile set cache is updated or removed
      cache - the array representing the uncovered tile set cache; if null, the existing entry is removed

    • setCardsDescriptions

      public void setCardsDescriptions(HashMap<Integer,String> cardsDescriptions)
      Sets the descriptions of the cards.
      Parameters:
      cardsDescriptions - a HashMap where the key is an Integer representing the card ID and the value is a String containing the description of the card.

    • setGameboard

      public void setGameboard(int x, int y, String[] cell)
      Sets the gameboard at the specified coordinates with the provided cell data.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the gameboard.
      y - the y-coordinate of the gameboard.
      cell - the data to set at the specified coordinates on the gameboard.

    • setGameboard

      public void setGameboard(int x, int y, int k, String cell)
      Sets the value of a specific cell in the gameboard.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the cell on the gameboard.
      y - The y-coordinate of the cell on the gameboard.
      k - The depth or layer index of the cell in the gameboard.
      cell - The value to be assigned to the specified cell.

    • setLv

      public void setLv(int lv)
      Sets the level value for the game or a particular component.
      Parameters:
      lv - the level value to be set.

    • setSetup

      public void setSetup(int setup)
      Sets the setup value for this instance.
      Parameters:
      setup - the integer value representing the setup configuration

    • setCoveredTileSet

      public void setCoveredTileSet(int coveredTileSet)
      Sets the value of the covered tile set.
      Parameters:
      coveredTileSet - an integer representing the new value for the covered tile set

    • setConnected

      public void setConnected(Boolean connected)

    • setLobby

      public void setLobby(String gameid, String[] cell)
      Sets or updates the lobby for a specified game. If the provided cell data is null, the game is removed from the lobby. Otherwise, the game ID and its associated cell data are added or updated in the lobby.
      Parameters:
      gameid - The unique identifier for the game.
      cell - An array of strings representing the cell data associated with the game. If null, the game will be removed from the lobby.

    • getPlayerBoard

      public String[][][] getPlayerBoard()
      Retrieves the player's cached game board data.
      Returns:
      a three-dimensional array of Strings representing the cached board of the player.

    • showLobby

      public StringBuilder showLobby()
      Generates a StringBuilder representation of the current lobby state. If the lobby is empty, a predefined ASCII art message indicating no games is appended. Otherwise, it iterates through the lobby's contents and formats them into a structured output.
      Returns:
      A StringBuilder object containing the formatted representation of the lobby state.

    • printBoard

      public StringBuilder printBoard()
      Generates a visual representation of the game board and returns it as a StringBuilder object. The method iterates through a predefined 2D cached board structure to construct a formatted string representation of the board. Additional ASCII art elements, such as a border or header, are appended to enhance visualization.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder containing the formatted string representation of the game board.

    • printBoard

      public StringBuilder printBoard(String[][][] board)
      Formats and prints a three-dimensional board as a string representation. Processes the given board array and appends formatted text to a StringBuilder which is then returned. The output includes specified rows and columns of the board formatted for display along with additional ASCII art borders.
      Parameters:
      board - a three-dimensional array representing the board, where the first dimension is rows, the second dimension is columns, and the third dimension contains string elements to be printed
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder object containing the formatted board representation

    • showUncoveredTiles

      public StringBuilder showUncoveredTiles()
      Constructs a visual representation of uncovered tiles using ASCII art. The uncovered tiles are displayed in groups of eight, each tile formatted with its respective position and visual representation from a cache.
      Returns:
      A StringBuilder containing the ASCII art representation of the uncovered tiles.

    • printHand

      public StringBuilder printHand()
      Builds and returns a StringBuilder object that represents the player's hand. The method compiles the ASCII representation of the hand, along with a border and any cached hand data, into a formatted structure suitable for display.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder object containing the ASCII representation of the hand.

    • printGameBoard

      public StringBuilder printGameBoard()
      Constructs and retrieves the visual representation of the game board, including ASCII art and the current state of the game board based on the specified level and dimensions.
      Returns:
      A StringBuilder object containing the formatted visual representation of the game board.

    • showPlayers

      public StringBuilder showPlayers()
      Generates a formatted string that displays the list of players and their readiness status.
      Returns:
      A StringBuilder containing the list of players along with their "Ready" or "Not Ready" status.

    • showGame

      public void showGame()
      Displays the current game state to the player. This method toggles the internal visibility state of the game, ensuring it is temporarily hidden and then shown to the player via the player's client interface. The player's client interface handles the rendering or processing of the game display.

    • getPositionToGameboard

      public HashMap<Integer,IntegerPair> getPositionToGameboard()
      Retrieves the mapping of positions to their corresponding gameboard coordinates.
      Returns:
      A HashMap where the key represents a position as an Integer and the value is an IntegerPair representing the coordinates on the gameboard.

    • initGameBoard

      public void initGameBoard(int lv)
      Initializes the gameboard and sets up the mapping of positions to their corresponding gameboard coordinates based on the specified level.
      Parameters:
      lv - the level of the gameboard to initialize. If lv is 2, a 6x12x7 gameboard is created. If lv is 1, a 5x11x7 gameboard is created.

    • setCacheCard

      public void setCacheCard(String s)
      Sets the value of the cache card.
      Parameters:
      s - the new value to set for CacheCard

    • setRewards

      public void setRewards(StringBuilder rewards)
      Sets the rewards information.
      Parameters:
      rewards - A StringBuilder object containing the rewards details to be set.

    • showCovered

      public StringBuilder showCovered()
      Generates a StringBuilder object that contains the ASCII art representation of covered tiles and the size of the CoveredTileSet.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder containing the ASCII art and the CoveredTileSet size

    • showCard

      public StringBuilder showCard()
      Displays the currently cached card along with associated ASCII art if available. If the CacheCard is empty, the method will return an empty StringBuilder.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder containing the ASCII art of a card followed by the cached card details, or an empty StringBuilder if no card is cached.

    • render

      public void render(StringBuilder sb)
      Renders the content to the provided StringBuilder by delegating the rendering task to the inputReader's renderScreen method.
      Parameters:
      sb - the StringBuilder instance to which the rendered content is appended

    • showRewards

      public StringBuilder showRewards()
      Displays the current rewards information.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder object containing the rewards details

    • setException

      public void setException(String exception)
      Sets the exception message.
      Parameters:
      exception - the exception message to be set

    • showException

      public StringBuilder showException()
      Handles and formats exception messages for output. If an exception message is present, it wraps the message in a formatted style and resets the exception to an empty state.
      Returns:
      A StringBuilder containing the formatted exception message, or an empty StringBuilder if no exception message is available.

    • seeBoards

      public void seeBoards()
      Displays the game boards of all players, including the current player's board. The method iterates through the boards of other players and appends their board representation with relevant details to a string. It includes a border and player name for context. Once all other players' boards are displayed, the current player's board is appended in a similar format. The complete result is then rendered to the screen using the provided input reader. Uses ASCII art for board decoration and separation.

    • setLog

      public void setLog(String message)
      Sets a log message and adds it to the log list in a formatted manner.
      Parameters:
      message - the log message to set and add to the log list

    • showCardEffect

      public StringBuilder showCardEffect()
      Displays the effect of a card if present. The effect is formatted with ANSI yellow color and returned as a StringBuilder. Once the effect is displayed, it is cleared.
      Returns:
      A StringBuilder containing the formatted effect text, or an empty StringBuilder if no effect is present.

    • getTitleCard

      public StringBuilder getTitleCard()
      Retrieves the title card as a StringBuilder.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder object containing the title card.

    • setPBInfo

      public void setPBInfo(String s)
      Sets the PBInfo property with the specified value.
      Parameters:
      s - the new value to set for PBInfo

    • showPbInfo

      public StringBuilder showPbInfo()
      Returns a StringBuilder object containing the PBInfo data.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder object representing the PBInfo data

    • setDeck

      public void setDeck(ArrayList<String> ids)
      Sets the deck with the given list of IDs.
      Parameters:
      ids - the list of card IDs to set as the deck

    • showDeck

      public StringBuilder showDeck()
      Displays the deck of cards in a formatted manner by aligning the contents of each card. Each card is split into lines, and cards are displayed side-by-side until all lines are exhausted. The deck is cleared after the operation.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder containing the formatted representation of the deck. If the deck is empty, returns an empty StringBuilder.

    • setHourglass

      public void setHourglass(boolean start, String message)
      Sets the hourglass state with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      start - a boolean indicating whether to start or stop the hourglass effect
      message - a string message associated with the hourglass effect

    • showHorglass

      public StringBuilder showHorglass()
      Generates a textual representation of an hourglass in ASCII art format. The representation depends on the current state of the hourglass.
      Returns:
      A StringBuilder object containing the ASCII art representation of either the starting or ending state of the hourglass.

    • showLog

      public StringBuilder showLog()
      Compiles all log entries into a single StringBuilder object, separating each entry with a newline character.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder containing all log entries, with each entry separated by a newline.

    • clearOut

      public void clearOut()
      Clears the contents of the lobby and log. This method resets the state by removing all elements from both the lobby and the log, ensuring they are empty.

    • showOutcome

      public StringBuilder showOutcome()
      Generates and returns a StringBuilder object containing the outcome.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder instance that holds the outcome value.

    • setOutcome

      public void setOutcome(String message, boolean outcome)
      Sets the outcome message based on the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      message - A string message (not used within the method logic).
      outcome - A boolean value representing the outcome; true for success ("hai vinto") and false for failure ("hai perso").

    • setScoreBoard

      public void setScoreBoard(StringBuilder sb)
      Sets the scoreboard with the provided StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      sb - the StringBuilder object containing the scoreboard data

    • showScoreboard

      public StringBuilder showScoreboard()
      Displays the current scoreboard. If the scoreboard is null, an empty StringBuilder is returned.
      Returns:
      a StringBuilder object representing the scoreboard, or an empty StringBuilder if the scoreboard is null
